Posts.Content: Hi I hate to be long winded but the full story has to be told so you can tell me if you can help or not. January 2016 diagnosed with 15mm idc in left breast, lumpectomy and 4 nodes removed.  Nodes clear but no clear margins, a further 3 operations and still no clear margins so mastectomy and DIEP reconstruction in June 2016.  No chemo or radiotherapy necessary, just tamoxifen. December 2017 I felt a lump under left arm pit, lump nothing but a cyst but biopsy of lymph node taken and positive cancer cells detected.  Ct scan clear, so just complete lymph node clearance, still waiting on pathology, should be next week.  But question is does anyone else had this after lymph nodes said to be all clear previously, if so what treatment did you get?   I am really concerned that I will never truly relax and never really trust the results. Thanks  Dolina
Posts.Title: Can anyone help me please with lymph node question please.

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your replies, the longer the waiting the more nervous I become.  Very weepy today, normally I have been quite strong, but today not so much.  I am so scared about the chemo route, it’s just so real, I thought I had been ‘lucky’ in avoiding chemo or radiotherapy but maybe not.  I hate being told how lucky I am in the cancer being detected by my first mammogram but I don’t feel lucky with operation after operation when I go in feeling fine and come out really sore for a few weeks. Sorry ladies and gents I am at a pity party, please don’t join me. Dolina xx Good sleep everyone x
Posts.Title: Can anyone help me please with lymph node question please.

Posts.Content: Hello Nicky, very scary time for you but rest assured everyone on the transplant team want the best for you.  I had a DIEP surgery in June and please don't get me wrong it's a tough surgery, 10 hours on the table and 5 in recovery, then 24 hour intensive nursing, half hourly checks,  I staying in hospital for 5 days, my drains were removed (3) then I was free to go home, first week you are definitely an invalid but you can go to the loo unaided, make a cup of tea etc, but that's about it.  Now 3 months later I have a large abdominal scar, hip to hip, a repositioned belly button and a new breast, and I also have a flat stomach!!! There has to be a plus to all this and that is it.  I would definitely have this surgery again, with out question, it's the best decision I made.  I no longer have cancer, did not need radiotherapy because there was nothing left to zap and am a firm believer in our wonderful NHS system Take care and all the very best Nicky, I hope this helps little bit Dolina xx
Posts.Title: Meet with Plastics Team Monday

Posts.Content: Hello, I am on clonidine for hot flushes, I have 25microgram tablets and take two, three times a day, so in a day its 150 micro grams.  I started on one a day, then one three times a day, no difference, then moved up to current dose and even though they have not disappeared they are greatly improved, I would say almost instantly working after being on correct doze. Hope that helps Dolina
Posts.Title: Anyone know dose of clonidine for hot flushes

Posts.Content: Hi Sophie, I don't know about magnesium but I am on chlonidine and anti depressants to help with hot flushes, I also bought cool bedding from marks and spencer and they have worked a little bit and the flushing has still been awful but bearable but three weeks ago I had 4 sessions of acupuncture and slowly the flushing has subsided, I maybe get 4 during the day and a couple at night, so a vast improvement, I believe some charities have it available free of charge. Hope this helps x

Posts.Title: Magnesium for hot flushes

Posts.Content: Hello London Lass, I am so very sorry you are having a terrible time, I can't help with your pain but I have been having terrible hot flushes ,  I told my gp that these were the worst things about getting breast cancer, interrupted sleep every night is no fun, I ended up sobbing, begging my gp to help and I am now on Clonodine which has helped tremendously, they have not gone away totally but are so much better, hardly ever waken up now.  You can also try certain anti-depressants, which can help with severe flushes but gp's are reluctant to prescribe these if you are not depressed.  I got told by a gp friend of mine, that if you cry during a consultation, they will take your problem more seriously, you might feel daft but it works. I really hope this helps x

Posts.Title: Is this it for now .

Posts.Content: So sorry Skye to hear of your family troubles, I really don't think people who have thankfully never had cancer do not comprehend the level of fear and frustration felt by someone going through treatment, luckily for me my husband and a few fantastic friends did everything for me during this time.  could you bypass your family and ask friends for help?  I have been told by friends that they felt helpless watching me go through this and they were desperate to help they just didn't know how, why don't you just ask your closest if she could maybe take care of your daughter in your home for the few days after chemo?  Leave your family out of it.  I live in Aberdeen and if you are close by, I would help you in any way. Take care Skye and get better soon.
Posts.Title: Support issues (again/still!!!)

Posts.Content: Thank you all ladies for your replies, it's just good to know I am not alone with the craziness.  X
Posts.Title: Now the treatment is over

Posts.Content: Hi, I have been through treatment recently and am recovering well, scars healing etc. I have been optimistic throughout and extremely grateful to everyone who helped me through this trauma but recently I have been going over and over in my head what happened, reliving being told I had BC, reliving the trips to theatre and conversations I had and the awful waiting for results.  I can't seem to stop thinking about it, even getting a bit teary when thinking about it. My mastectomy was in June and I just want to forget this and move on but my brain won't let me.  Has anybody else had this, I feel I am going mad, why can't I just let it go? Any tips or thoughts would be gratefully received.
Posts.Title: Now the treatment is over

Posts.Content: Hi, I was hoping for some advice please.  I have a lump just above my belly button which is very painful, I told the plastic surgeon in July who sent me for an ultrasound which I had two weeks ago. The ultrasound bloke told me I had a very small hernia and that was the source of the pain.  I got my appointment to discuss the results with the plastic surgeon and its in the middle of December, which to be honest was a bit of a shock as I am in pain constantly so I phoned the hospital and explained I was in pain and needed an earlier appointment and I was told there were no earlier appointments.  To be honest I really don't mean to be a wimp but I just don't know what to do, I am still taking Tramadol for the pain, these were prescribed for the reconstruction op.  Any advice would be greatly appreciated.

Posts.Title: Hernia following DIEP surgery

Posts.Content: Best thing I took was a mist spray, just with water, hospital keeps the room after diep really warm and with hot flushes sometimes really hot, nice spray of water was lovely.  Good luck, it's not as bad as you fear x
Posts.Title: What to take to hospital?

Posts.Content: Hello Imelda, had my first T on Friday,everything hunky dorey til Monday, OMG it was not amusing, T train came to visit, slept all day Monday and Tuesday and wednesday, got out of bed last night to watch a movie and feel much better today. Feet feel a bit strange and my finger nails are really sore but it’s done til next one. Doable but not pleasant but only slight sickness which was a huge relief for my.  I do get daily injections in my belly but numb there anyway due to DIEP Surgery.  You take it easy and be kind to yourself.  Away to do a load of washing as the kids have “nothing”to wear. Dolina xx
Posts.Title: Finished Fec .

Posts.Content: i posted a couple of weeks ago about a small lump I found under my arm and assumed it was a lymph note, I phoned the BCN and told her, I was then given an ultrasound last week, the ultrasound dude said the lump was nothing just a wee cyst nothing to worry about but as I was there he would just have a look at the lymph nodes and make sure everything was hunky dorey  but he found a couple of “juicy” nodes and took a needle biopsy there and then.  My BCN has been on the phone today to ask me to get some bloods done to check my kidney function and then have a ct done, she said that the formal report hasn’t been sent through but they are very concerned.  Has anyone else had this and what will happen next?  I just need to know and I don’t want to talk to friends as I am fed up being told everything will be fine, when no one knows that.  Sorry if that sounds a bit grump but I am really worried . Dolina x
